name: Roast Potatoes with Sausage and Feta
keywords: Roast Potatoes, Sausage, Feta, Rosemary, Crispy, Winter, Dinner, Potatoes, Side Dish, Easy, Family Friendly, Comfort Food, One-Pan, Sausage and Feta, Weeknight Meal, Lunch
description: Delightfully crispy and soft roast potatoes enhanced with the strong flavors of sausage, feta, and rosemary
recipeIngredient: 6 Sausages, I like pork and fennel but any with strong flavors do well

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an oven to 220C (fan) and bring a pot of water to boil.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat and Boil

recipeInstructions.text: Cut your potatoes into chunks and boil for about 20 minutes or until potatoes are starting to fall apart (skin coming away).
recipeInstructions.name: Boil Potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Once potatoes are cooked, drain in a colander and toss a little bit to fluff up the potatoes a bit, this will help make better crunchy goodness.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain and Fluff

recipeInstructions.text: Cut sausage into small bite-sized pieces and put in a baking tray. Crumble chunks of feta and add to the tray along with the potatoes. Splash olive oil over everything and toss in the tray to ensure everything is coated well. Sprinkle some rosemary.
recipeInstructions.name: Assemble in Tray

recipeInstructions.text: Cook for about 40 minutes in the oven or until the potatoes are sufficiently crispy and golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Roast

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle salt over the top and enjoy with gravy or some other delicious sauce like romesco.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

notes: Great with garlic and onion roasted in the tray with everything else.
Try adding different herbs and spices to customize the flavor.
These potatoes can be served as a side dish or a main course with a salad.
